intro: Chrysopia macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaf chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers and serrated, lance-shaped leaves. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and full sunlight. Chrysopia macrophylla is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its vibrant blooms and adaptability to various garden settings.
